Tell city councilors to Press Pause on this dangerous, unregulated technology.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌
Take Action Now

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

We've got a shot at stopping the spread of unregulated, dystopian surveillance tech in Springfield – but we need your help.

City councilors are meeting on October 21 to discuss a moratorium on municipal use of face surveillance technology. Let them know that the privacy of Springfield residents is not up for grabs: Add your name to our petition and show your support for this moratorium.

Face surveillance poses unprecedented risks to our civil rights and civil liberties. It's also entirely unregulated nationwide. We need to Press Pause on government use of face surveillance so we can safeguard our basic freedoms.

Massachusetts voters overwhelmingly agree: The government should not have the power to monitor our every move. In a recent poll, 79 percent of Massachusetts voters said they support a moratorium to Press Pause on government use of face surveillance technology.

Now we have a chance to make our voices heard and safeguard civil liberties for everyone in Springfield. Are you in?

Thanks for sticking with us,

Kade Crockford
Director, Technology for Liberty Program
ACLU of Massachusetts
